column2: BipolarVet, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am taking 25 mg per night to address the manic part of my bipolar disorder.  Even at such a low dosage, it makes me very drowsy and it's hard to get started in the morning.  On average, I sleep between 10-12 hours a day with clozapine, when I used to sleep more like 7-8 hours.  Also, I have to have quite frequent blood tests to make sure my white cell count is not too low from the clozapine.  However, in spite of all these negatives, I still am glad to be on it because it has helped me remain stable and avoid hospitalizations for the past year and 8 months.

column2: Judy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My Father had Parkinson's, mild dementia, and heart stents.  One dose at bedtime, he passed away the next morning!  Do not recomend!!!

column2: ccbbozz, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Worked 4 me, very quickly was hospitalized when they started it, my 1st experience w/hallucinations. Stopped them,none in 6 yrs,blood draw monthly.It's a life saver, I haven't experienced any negative side effects or allergic effects .

column2: saginaw, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: My son  was diagnosed with chronic schizophrenia at age 18. I want people to know that there is a great alternative to this illness....The pfieffer treatment center. It was the first step to his treatment of schizophrenia and it worked to clear out some of his symptoms...if any one wants more info I encourage them to google this clinic or e-mail me at imlovinglife47@hotmail.com I will give honest feed back about this experience with my son

column2: Starwood,  Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: My son had been tormented with mental illness since in high school. He attempted suicide 2 times heard voices and thought tv and radios were talking to him. He had been in mental hospital 3 times, and it was not until a very excellent psychiatrist started him on clozaril, that it was like a miracle. He is on very low doses and can function now , go to school and work. He is also on low dose lithium at bedtime. Although monthly blood draws can be a nuisance , it is well worth the inconvenience.  he also has an excellent therapist who helps him look forward and not rehash the past.

column2: goddess, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
awsomkris, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: very calming

column2: booboo1962, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
sydmac50@yahoo.com, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Caregiver)
column9: I am the younger brother and legal guardian to a 55 year old femal that has been on this treatment (colzapine) for approximately 20 years and we are finding that there are many problems after prolonged use of this medication. The reason that this treatment was sought was because the alternitive tretments were so devistateing to her general health and mental behavior. The alternitive medications were stelzine, thorzine, and heldol. Currently she is recieving 500 mg per day of clozapine along with other medications but as of the last 6 months she has been experianceing total regression of her illness, in other words she now is worse than she's been in the past 15 years. I would like to find a alternitive to clozapine. I would like to try a medication that was designed for a female if at all possible. She has been hospitalized 4 times in the last 6 months and I'm running out of options. Any sugestions would be greatly appretiated.

column2: blueangel, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: My daughter was placed on Clozaril (Clozapine) 3 or 4 years ago and has done extremely well on this medication. She had been on everything else and this is the 1st time a med has worked for her. Both of us are very happy with this medication. High praises from both of us.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was on 3 other types of antipsychotics before trying clozapine, it has definetly made a huge difference but the effectiveness is starting to wear off after 4 years on this medicine-

column2: Mia, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My 42 yr old son had paronoid bipolar and was on clozapine for l6 days.  He wasn't even suicicidal.  He died on the l6th day of being on clozapine. He died of a heart attack.   I say take this horrible drug off the market.  It kills people.  He was healthy before he started taking clozapine.  I blame the doctor for putting him on it when he wasn't even suicidal.  There were other drugs he could have put him on.  Now we lost out beautiful 42 yr old son.

column2: Rwon410141, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Best drug on the market for killing anxiety!!! Been on for more than 3 years.

column2: ocdtootsie, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taken high dosage of this medication for 6 yrs now.  It has helped but still periodically suffer setbacks.  Mostly obsessing and depression but have recently been given medications for those conditions.

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: Nothing worked for my daughter except this. She has been on this medication for 4 years, blood draws are only once every month now. This has been the best medication and she has tried them all!

column2: 25-34 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I suffer from Bi-Polar disorder.  This medication helps me sleep which is great.  The affects are blurred vision, tremors, increased saliva, tongue movements, dizziness and tiredness.  The blood test are a pain but worth it despite the affects.

column2: Chrissy, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: This medication has been a possitive experience for my patient. He no longer has hellucinations. This has given him a better life.

column2: speedylee, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: Tried all other antipsychotics and Clozapine has been superior.  Found that using Clozapine with Haldol (or other antipsychotic) is not a good idea.  Clozapine alone, is best.  Give it at least 6-9 months and don't be afraid to go up on dosage if all testing indicates ok to do so.

column2: rene, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: our son was doing terrible with all other meds but this one really helped him so very much. thank you

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: So far so good.Weekly bloodwork a hassle.

column2: Josie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My Dr. prescribed this for me because I have anxiety.  The only real problem I had was the dosage.  This pill comes in a 50mg tab and I cut it to 25mg and I was still dizy so I cut that in 1/2 so 12.5 mgs and now I'm very good.  So I've had a positive experience except of course when I first wake up in the morning it's slow going.
